November 22, 1963
AHMC - Kennedy Assassination TeletypesCollection processed by Larry WeimerNew-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2020-11-24T22:02:42Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard The documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
John F. Kennedy assassination teletypes
Newark Evening News (Newark, N.J.)
AHMC - Kennedy Assassination Teletypes
.1 Linear feet in 4 folders
1963 November 22 The collection primarily includes about 85 teletype print-outs (also referred to as telexes) headed as bulletins or urgent that were received at the Newark Evening News on November 22, 1963, regarding the assassination of U.S. President John F. Kennedy on that day in Dallas, Texas. Sources include the Associated Press (The AP) and United Press International (UPI) among others. The collection also includes a few of the sheets of ink paper used to print the teletypes and a few preliminary Evening News articles, including one written by staff correspondent William May.
To request this material for research, and for fuller information about it, please follow this link to the record in N-YHS's catalog, Bobcat: John F. Kennedy assassination teletypes
